cluster_relations.rel_desc: Host plants serve as a food source for the emerging caterpillar (larval) stage.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject serves as a food resource for the object in a trophic interaction.
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: Butterfly Host Plants and Larval Resources
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Butterfly Ecology, Habitat, and Food Web

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: for emerging larvae, shortly after hatching

remarks: Emerging larvae correspond to the caterpillar larval stage.
Emerging larvae correspond to the caterpillar larval stage.
Emerging larvae correspond to the caterpillar larval stage.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Predators of butterfly eggs prey on butterflies in the egg stage.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject organism (predator) preys upon, harms, or consumes the object organism or life stage as a food source.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Butterfly Ecology, Habitat, and Food Web

qualifiers.SpatialQualifier: near or on leaves where eggs are laid
qualifiers.CausalHint: threat that motivates protective egg-laying behavior

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Caterpillars in the larval stage feed on plant leaves as their primary food source.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject organism consumes the object as a primary or regular food source, without necessarily implying a predator-prey dynamic.
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Butterfly Egg-Laying Sites and Larval Food Leaves
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Butterfly Ecology, Habitat, and Food Web

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: most of their time spent feeding
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Behavior: voracious eating and rapid growth while feeding

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Predators of caterpillars prey upon caterpillars.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject organism (predator) preys upon, harms, or consumes the object organism or life stage as a food source.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Butterfly Ecology, Habitat, and Food Web

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: when caterpillars are detected despite camouflage/defenses

remarks: Predation is implied rather than explicitly spelled out.
Predation is implied rather than explicitly spelled out.
Predation is implied rather than explicitly spelled out.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: During the adult life stage, butterflies feed on nectar.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject organism or life stage obtains food by consuming the object, which serves as its trophic resource.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The proboscis is used to drink nectar as food.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject structure is used to consume or ingest the object substance as food.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Nectar consumed by butterflies originates from flowers.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject substance or resource is generated, secreted, or produced by the object organism or structure.
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Flowering plant reproductive structures and organisms

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Adult butterflies visit flowers while feeding on nectar.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject organism feeds at or on the object, which serves as the feeding site or resource location.
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Flowering plant reproductive structures and organisms

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Adult butterflies serve in the role of a food source.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject has a specified trophic or prey/predator role in an ecosystem (here, serving as a food source).
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Butterfly Ecology, Habitat, and Food Web

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Birds consume butterflies, for which butterflies act as a food source.

cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Butterfly Ecology, Habitat, and Food Web

qualifiers.UncertaintyQualifier: may (in description of reptiles, but birds likely too)

remarks: Object is the role 'food source' rather than butterflies entity, consistent with provided nodes.
